question: In many countries, children are becoming overweight and unhealthy. Some think that the government has the responsibility to solve this problem. To what extent do you agree or disagree?
text: Undoubtedly,the food culture is changed drastically over the years.The average weight of the heir in most of the countries is quite high.Some people argue that  authorities are responsible for the obesity among children   whereas their counterparts disagree with the argument.Both sides of the argument are discussed in the forthcoming paragraphs and I side with the latter argument.

Firstly,the major cause of overweight among children is the fast evolvement of the fast-food industry.For example,a survey shows that the major consumer of Coke is heir below ten years.Authorities should consider this factor and put more  regulations on the fast-food industries.

On the contrary,adolescents tend to imitate the eating habit of their parents.Due to the busy life schedule,adults consume snack bars and junk food on a regular basis.Additionally,the cooking culture is vanishing due to the fast evolvement of food delivery applications.These companies provide exciting offers and hence people are biased a lot to them.For instance,local food delivery app Yemmitto provide a variety of offers to the customers to compete with giants like zomato.Furthermore, the unhealthy lifestyle of parents are copied by the offspring and this habit is the root cause of obesity.Moreover,adults should follow a strict healthy meal plan and they should constantly monitor the food habit of their younger generation.

To conclude,even though the huge influence of the junk industry is vital  in  obesity among children,the main culprit is the parents.A healthy diet plan should be followed by each individual to maintain a healthy body.Therefore,adults should maintain a healthy body and should set themselves as  role models for the next generation.
